name: UpdateAllocation
description:
Update an existing allocation in Asana.

Use this tool to update an existing allocation in Asana by providing specific fields to be changed. Unspecified fields will remain unchanged.

parameters.name: allocation_global_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the allocation to be updated. This is required to specify which allocation record to modify.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the allocation.

parameters.name: updated_allocation_fields
parameters.description: JSON object containing the fields to be updated for the allocation. Only provided fields will be changed, others remain untouched.

value_schema.description: The updated fields for the allocation.

parameters.name: include_optional_fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of optional properties to include in the response.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Set to true to receive the response in a more readable, formatted JSON output. This increases response size and should be used mainly for debugging purposes.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: opt_pretty
parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: opt_fields
parameters.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: allocation_gid
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the allocation.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the allocation.

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: The updated fields for the allocation.

value_schema.description: The updated fields for the allocation.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
